contentrichtext.text: {{for|the Canadian cricketer|Zahid Hussain (cricketer)}} '''Zahid Husain''' (1895 - 1957) was the first [[governor]] of [[State Bank of Pakistan]] from June 1948 to July 1953.<ref name="sbp">[http://www.sbp.org.pk/museum/Gov_ZhdHus.htm Zahid Hussain] State Bank of Pakistan. Retrieved 22 June 2013.</ref> He also served as Pakistan's first [[High Commissioner (Commonwealth)|High Commissioner]] to [[India]] from August 1947 to April 1948.<ref name="sbp"/> He was close aide of [[Quaid-e-Azam Muhammad Ali Jinnah]], and also the father of [[Supreme Court of Pakistan]] [[Justice]] (R) [[Nasir Aslam Zahid]]. ==Career== Zahid remained [[chancellor (education)|vice-chancellor]] of [[Aligarh Muslim University]], the first chairman of the [[Planning Commission (Pakistan)|Planning Commission]] and the author of Pakistan's first five-year plan. ==See also== * [[Governor of the State Bank of Pakistan]] ==References== <references /> ==Links== * [http://www.sbp.org.pk/about/governors/past.htm State Bank of Pakistan Past Governors] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Husain, Zahid | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1893 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Karnal (India) | DATE OF DEATH = 1957 | PLACE OF DEATH = Karachi (Pakistan) }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hussain, Zahid}} [[Category:Muhajir people]] [[Category:Pakistani academics]] [[Category:Pakistani diplomats]] [[Category:Pakistani bankers]] [[Category:Pakistani bureaucrats]] [[Category:State Bank of Pakistan]] [[Category:Governors of the State Bank of Pakistan]] [[Category:1957 deaths]] [[Category:Aligarh Muslim University faculty]] [[Category:High Commissioners of Pakistan to India]]
